subject: RE: [junit] Parameterisation of tests in JUnit4
msgSnippet: ... Righto. I ll refetch the vanilla version from CVS and start off with a new annotation. From what I remember from my previous look (I confess the whole
messageBody:
Kent wrote:
> We intend only to provide basic parameterized test cases in
> our distribution. However, @RunWith provides a nice place to
> plug in a more flexible style of parameterized tests. If this
> would benefit you, it seems reasonable for you to write it
> and later see if it generally useful.

Righto. I'll refetch the "vanilla" version from CVS and start off with a
new annotation.

From what I remember from my previous look (I confess the whole thing's
getting slightly confusing at the moment as I'm also looking at the
TestNG source code, and how hard it would be to implement the same
functionality there), there are a few members which are currently
private but which would make life a lot easier if they were protected:

TestMethodRunner.addFailure
TestMethodRunner.fTest
TestMethodRunner.fNotifier

I'm sure there was another one somewhere, but I can't find it at the
moment.

I'll write my extension assuming these have been made protected, then
submit patches to the CVS tree to see whether that would be acceptable.

Jon
